snippet.textDisplay:
katamari dekitara dekakemashou 
rojiura wo burabura sanpo shimasen ka? 
hora mado no soto mitegoran 
sora ni wa hikoukigumo 
sore wa sukimakaze fuku 
koharubiyori no koro deshita

hirusagari machi wo tansakuchuu 
kimi no te o tori sukoshiteiru 
chiisana koto de shiawase wwo kanjiru 
koro deshita ah...

ooh... momoiro no 
nigiyaka na kisetsu deshita

lalala...

kimi to boku wa ima kangaeru 
sukoshi bakari seichou shita kara 
chiisa na koto de shiawase wo kanjitai 
toki nandesu ooh... 
ooh... sakura iro no 
nigiyaka na kisetsu deshita

lalala...
****************************************************************

When the katamari's ready, let's go out 
Shall we aimlessly stroll down the back streets? 
Look, take a look out the window 
a vapor trail in the sky 
That was when 
a warm summer breeze blew in

In the process of searching the early afternoon town 
I take your hand and we pass the time 
It was a time we felt happiness in the little things 
ah...

ooh... It was a lively, 
peach-colored season

lalala...

You and I will now think 
because we grew just a tiny bit 
It's a time we want to feel happiness 
with little things 
ooh... It was a lively, 
cherry-blossom colored season

lalala...

snippet.textDisplay: @Mitchell Scripter The ones who are so fortunate to be rolled up in His Katamari are happy to be there. Any screams you hear are screams of joy and grateful submission. You are chosen to be liberated from your Earth life to live forever as a beautiful burning star in service to the entire cosmos, it is an honor most grand and to not be glad to be clumped together with such love and purpose is besmirching His gifts. Thank existence for the King of All Cosmos. (and The Prince)
snippet.textOriginal: @Mitchell Scripter The ones who are so fortunate to be rolled up in His Katamari are happy to be there. Any screams you hear are screams of joy and grateful submission. You are chosen to be liberated from your Earth life to live forever as a beautiful burning star in service to the entire cosmos, it is an honor most grand and to not be glad to be clumped together with such love and purpose is besmirching His gifts. Thank existence for the King of All Cosmos. (and The Prince)

snippet.textDisplay:
This is probably the most beautiful song I've ever heard, but.....

I can't help but imagine how this was recorded:  A teacher directing a choir of chubby Asian children, while the orchestra plays and one man sits on a stool with a cigarette in his mouth tapping the bass drum and hi-hat with his feet.
snippet.textOriginal:
This is probably the most beautiful song I've ever heard, but.....

I can't help but imagine how this was recorded:  A teacher directing a choir of chubby Asian children, while the orchestra plays and one man sits on a stool with a cigarette in his mouth tapping the bass drum and hi-hat with his feet.

snippet.textDisplay: One of the most beautiful and touching songs I have ever heard in my life. It is simultaneously warming and a little painfully sad...it is a song that makes me recall the one who introduced me to the first Katamari Damacy, and we were together many years before his sudden passing. I always think back to that 'cherry-blossom color season' now, whenever I hear this song...
snippet.textOriginal: One of the most beautiful and touching songs I have ever heard in my life. It is simultaneously warming and a little painfully sad...it is a song that makes me recall the one who introduced me to the first Katamari Damacy, and we were together many years before his sudden passing. I always think back to that 'cherry-blossom color season' now, whenever I hear this song...

snippet.textDisplay:
actually me and a few friends danced to this song in a parade once (not gaypride :P)
sweet memories. we used to imagine fat japanese boys in sailorcostumes eating large amounts of cheesypoofs between the lyrics. 

the songs is about a boy and a girl who looks back at their life during childhood when every thing was and they were chasing insects and having fun and how the seasons and "soulcube" brought change as they grew up is i remember correctly. :)
it is performed by Yu Miyake
